"This looks like the control room...." Guardia said.  "Get ready, this might
work..."

Guardia typed the universal Maximal security override into the panel next to
the door.  To her surprise the door suddenly slid open, and the lights in
the room flickered on.  Revealing a long room with a row of CR chambers,
weapon's lockers, a row of mainframe computers and an operations center.
Everything looked clean, as if the fighting had never reached this room.

Ravenchief took point and slowly entered the room, hovering above the ground
gently with his pistol at the ready.  Guardia and the two troopers followed.

"Get in and we'll seal the door.  Sweep the room for hostiles."

On Mon, Nov 30, 2009 at 8:51 AM, Sandy <magicquartz@...> wrote:

> Tucson could feel the blast marks with his hands, and the texture of the
> distorted metal where the weapons struck the doors and structures. He knew
> that just by the feel, things must have gotten ugly.
>
> " Hmm..  Yeah, I'd say this has been abandoned for quite a long time. But I
> wouldn't let any guards down yet.  Looks can be deceiving. Guardia,
> Ravenchief, if you could, since I'm visually impaired, is there any chance
> that there is a computer that still functions that could give us any
> indication as to what happened here, and if there is, could you see if you
> can pull something up on it?  That may give us some indications as to who or
> what attacked this base."
>
> He continues to investigate along with Guardia and the others.  He could
> still hear signals coming off his sonar systems, which often meant that
> someone or something else could be lurking.  His expressions change as he
> picks up the resounding signals.
>
> " I know you're here...   But where?"  He exclaims to himself.
>
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Kraftlos <kraftlos@...> wrote:

"This looks like the control room...." Guardia said.=C2=A0 "=
Get ready, this might work..."<br><br>Guardia typed the universal Maxi=
mal security override into the panel next to the door.=C2=A0 To her surpris=
e the door suddenly slid open, and the lights in the room flickered on.=C2=
=A0 Revealing a long room with a row of CR chambers, weapon's lockers, =
a row of mainframe computers and an operations center.=C2=A0 Everything loo=
ked clean, as if the fighting had never reached this room.<br>

<br>Ravench=
ief took point and slowly entered the room, hovering above the ground gentl=
y with his pistol at the ready.=C2=A0 Guardia and the two troopers followed=
.<br><br>"Get in and we'll seal the door.=C2=A0 Sweep the room for=
 hostiles."<br>

<br><div class=3D"gmail_quote">On Mon, Nov 30, 2009 a=
t 8:51 AM, Sandy <span dir=3D"ltr"><<a href=3D"mailto:magicquartz@yahoo.=
com">magicquartz@...</a>></span> wrote:<br><blockquote class=3D"gm=
ail_quote" style=3D"border-left: 1px solid rgb(204, 204, 204); margin: 0pt =
0pt 0pt 0.8ex; padding-left: 1ex;">

Tucson could feel the blast marks with=
 his hands, and the texture of the distorted metal where the weapons struck=
 the doors and structures. He knew that just by the feel, things must have =
gotten ugly.<br>
<br>
" Hmm.. =C2=A0Yeah, I'd say this has been ab=
andoned for quite a long time. But I wouldn't let any guards down yet. =
=C2=A0Looks can be deceiving. Guardia, Ravenchief, if you could, since I&#3=
9;m visually impaired, is there any chance that there is a computer that st=
ill functions that could give us any indication as to what happened here, a=
nd if there is, could you see if you can pull something up on it? =C2=A0Tha=
t may give us some indications as to who or what attacked this base."<=
br>


<br>
He continues to investigate along with Guardia and the others. =
=C2=A0He could still hear signals coming off his sonar systems, which often=
 meant that someone or something else could be lurking. =C2=A0His expressio=
ns change as he picks up the resounding signals.<br>


<br>
" I know y=
ou're here... =C2=A0 But where?" =C2=A0He exclaims to himself.<br>=
